intro: Pleurostachys cimaensis, commonly known as the Cimaensis grass, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
